readme:
# asm2 package

Allows you to set up multiple configs in atom and easily switch between them.

## Installation

It's recommended to make a copy of your atom config (`~/.atom/config.cson`) before installing asm2!

You can install this package in the Atom setting or using apm (If you have installed the Atom Shell commands):

```bash
$ apm install asm2
```

Once asm2 is installed, it will create a `asm2` folder in your atom config folder (normally located in `~/.atom/`).

## Configuration

Like the default atom config the configuration files for asm2 are written in [cson]().

Your config files are stored in the `~/.atom/asm2/configs/` folder. You can open this folder from within atom using the menu bar (Packages -> asm2 -> Open config folder).

You can simply put multiple config files there.

If you create a config file named for example `code-js-standart.cson` asm2 will attempt to load `code-js.cson` and `code.cson`. Config settings in `code-js-standart.cson` will override settings in for example `code-js.cson`.
This way you don't have to define all your config settings in every config file. You can simply depend on your default config and make the changes you want to make.

## Usage

Selecting a config will override your old config, make sure to backup your old config file (`~/.atom/config.cson`)!

Once you have created a couple config files you can open Atom and select a config by pressing ctrl-alt-o or using the menu bar (Packages -> asm2 -> Set config).
You can change the keybinding in your keymap (the command is `asm2:setconfig`).
